TextView.android:text: symptoms • Urinating often. • increased hunger • Feeling very thirsty. • blurry vision • Feeling very hungry—even though you are eating. • Extreme fatigue. • Blurry vision. • Cuts/bruises that are slow to heal. • Weight loss—even though you are eating more • Tingling, pain, or numbness in the hands/feet Foods to Avoid • Sugar-Sweetened Beverages. Sugary beverages are the worst drink choice for someone with diabetes. • Trans Fats. • White Bread, Pasta and Rice. • Fruit-Flavored Yogurt. • Sweetened Breakfast Cereals. • Flavored Coffee Drinks. • Honey, Agave Nectar and Maple Syrup. • Dried Fruit. Foods to take • Fatty Fish. Some people consider fatty fish to be one of the healthiest foods on the planet. • Leafy Greens. Leafy green vegetables are extremely nutritious and low in calories. • Avocados • Eggs • Chia Seeds • Beans • Greek Yogurt • Nuts. • Broccoli • extra-virgin olive oil • Flaxseeds • apple cider vinegar • strawberries • garlic • Squash • Shirataki noodles
